name: Park Hyatt Melbourne

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at the Park Hyatt on our honeymoon and had a lovely time. The room was clean and spacious and had a lovely view. It might have been nice for them to do something like a bottle of champange in the room as they knew why we were staying but that is neither here nor there.
reviews.title: Lovely

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2008, traveled on business
reviews.text: We had a late lunch in the hotel lobby which was very tasty and not to mention huge! The staff reccomended a place for dinner which was also very good. I would definately stay here again.
reviews.title: Poor service lets a good hotel down

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2008, traveled on business
reviews.text: In the last three months of 2008, I would have clocked about 24 nights at the Park Hyatt in Melbourne.
reviews.title: Still a great hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2008, traveled on business
reviews.text: In all that time, I can truly report that my experiences at the hotel have ranged from poor to average, and certainly not deserving of the "one of best in Melbourne" tag.
reviews.title: Shoddy service lets it down

likes.liked: — Spacious rooms and sofas, log fireplace, the art
likes.disliked: — Variable quality service in cafe and rooms service, bad work desk arrangements

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: As mentioned elsewhere, soundproofing in the rooms is average. I've stayed in a number of rooms on a number of floors and in both wings and corridor traffic is clearly audible as are, ah, more amorous noises from ajoining rooms.
reviews.title: Grand and Charming

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Have been staying regularly at the Park Hyatt and have found the hotel, facilities and staff to be excellent. To walk in to the hotel to check in and have staff remember your name is uplifting. The staff are always helpful and able to provide advice on anything that you need. The rooms are spacious and the bathrooms indulgent. The buffet breakfast is incredible and first class dining can be had at night too. It's location enables you to take in the the culture of the the theatres, excellent restaurants, concerts and of course the first class sporting facilities. If you can take in the executive lounge it's well worth it.
reviews.title: First class hotel - Melbourne
Luxury hotel in great location
reviews.text: First the positives, as we were on our honeymoon we were upgraded which was lovely and our room was outstanding, it really couldn't be faulted.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2013
reviews.text: The only things that let this hotel down in my view were some of the staff, when checking out we were ignored in favour of a Porsche driver who had just pulled up and making the initial booking proved to be rather robotic and frustrating. The pool was large but absolutely freezing!
reviews.title: The perfect wedding experience

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Where do I start...
reviews.title: Flowless experience every time

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled on business
reviews.text: Firstly I'd like to thank Sarah and her wonderful team at the Park Hyatt for such a tremendous job with our wedding.
reviews.title: Top hotel
Lovely quiet hotel
reviews.text: My husband and I stayed here for 1 night for our wedding anniversary.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had a Club King room. Fantastic view of the city and nice large room with big bathroom. The toiletries supplied smell divine....Bergamot. We had drinks and canapés in the Club Lounge and thoroughly enjoyed this, indulging in NZ sav blanc and food such as won tons and spring rolls. Brekky was in their signature restaurant Radii, and made to order pancakes were delicious. We thoroughly enjoyed our stay and will definitely return. We've stayed in many hotels around the world and they are often very noisy at night. The Park Hyatt was surprisingly quiet. Staff were all very friendly and obliging... Myrna in Club Lounge was chatty and efficient. Thankyou to the young gentleman at the Front Desk who found our missing phone in our room! Well Done Park Hyatt!
reviews.title: Fabulous Friday night

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We decided to treat ourselves to a Friday night in the city and stay at a classy hotel. The Park Hyatt was a good choice. We got a deal which included breakfast on Saturday morning and valet parking. I drove into town for the first time, and it wasn't as daunting as I'd always thought it would be. The valet parked the car and I was able to go shopping for a couple of hours, before my husband finished work and walked up and met me at the hotel. We went for a swim in the day spa area - the pool was quite large and I was able to do lengths in it. There was only one other person swimming while we were there. After our exercise, we sat in the spa which was very relaxing.
reviews.title: Lovely Hotel - Large tasteful room but shame about the view

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: After all the walkingin town and swimming I was weary, so we just had dinner in the room, which arrived promptly and was delicious.The room itself was spacious and comfortable, and the bathroom was gorgeous. Full marble with a large spa with a (second) television set into the wall above it. It was all very luxurious and we loved it. In the morning, we had the full breakfast provided which was delicious and of a very high quality. The checkout was at 11am, so we enjoyed a bit of a sleep-in. My husband remarked that staying there on the Friday night made the weekend seem longer. We really enjoyed it.
reviews.title: Another Trip to Melbourne
Just lovely!!!
reviews.text: My husband booked this hotel for a special occasion in October and specifically requested with staff upon booking to have a nice room with a city view. The room was lovely. It was on the club level and was large & tastefully decorated. The view, however, was an enormous disappointment. We overlooked the rear of other buildings and the garbage disposal area at the back of one building. As for the city view - well you could see a few lights over top of the other buildings that our room faced on to. We stayed on a Monday and Tuesday night and the hotel seemed to be nowhere near full capacity so we can't understand why we were allocated such a room. In hindsight we should have returned to reception and asked if we could be allocated an alternate room

reviews.title: Luxury in Melbourne
reviews.text: We enjoyed a couple of nights here after two at the IC - the Park Hyatt is definitely a step up in quality. Superb Spa Deluxe room, with a bathroom the size of a small apartment. Sadly we did not have a chance to play tennis on the rooftop court. The pool was beautiful though a little chilly. The club lounge is worth the extra, friendly staff. We also had a complimentary formal "afternoon tea" here - we were amused that this included free sparkling wine but the actual tea was extra!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Could not fault the Park Hyatt Melbourne, exceptional service for our stay. Quick check-in and check-out, Valet Parking available. Best buffet breakfast in Melbourne. Rooms are exceptional. Definately will not disappoint.
reviews.title: Looking for Excellence
Flawless
reviews.text: Had visited Melbourne a few times before but this was the first time staying here and will say we will stay here again next time we visit Melbourne.

reviews.title: True test is how a hotel reacts to a problem
reviews.text: Everything from concierge to the room was perfect and could not fault. The decor of the hotel was luxurious yet warm and comfortable, staff was so very helpful, room service was above what I would expect in Australia, and the cocktails in the bar were well made. I loved the touch of the surprise complimentary sparkling wine and chocolates at arrival in both rooms we had (2 couples in our party).

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2013, traveled with friends
reviews.text: The location of the hotel is perfect, just outside of the cbd, but still walking distance to most things. Set amongst parkland made it so tranquil compared to staying right in the cbd.
reviews.title: Great Stay - Thank You!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2013, traveled solo
reviews.text: Stayed at the Park Hyatt for 2 nights on a short break. It's a quiet leafy location, just off to the corner of the CBD. I had requested, and was given, an early check-in which I greatly appreciated. My room was clean, spacious and luxurious. I found the business centre handy with its iMac, PC and a printer. The lap pool looked inviting and the gym had a good range of equipment. I enjoyed the full buffet breakfast at the in-house restaurant, Radii, but was less impressed by it at dinner due to slow service and the tough meat in my duck dish. The Park Hyatt is a wonderfully relaxing place to stay, but probably best try the great range of restaurants nearby for dinner.
reviews.title: Quiet luxury in Melbourne

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We recently spent 7 days in our first trip to Melbourne. The first four days were at the Westin Melbourne followed by three nights at the Park Hyatt. Our previous experiences with the Park Hyatt Sydney led to expect much more from the hotel. The staff overall had a whimsical demeanor and never went out of our way to greet us. Our room had electrical light problems (lights turned off and on when you were in the shower) and it was located on the side of the building where you heard PA announcements from the hospital most mornings. No treats delivered to your room and in our case they weren't concerned to deliver us the daily paper we requested.
reviews.title: Not on par with Park Hyatt service & amenities.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2013, traveled on business
reviews.text: It will not be a hotel we stay at again. The Park Hyatt ambience did not exist.
reviews.title: Very Hyatt-ish

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2013, traveled solo
reviews.text: Whilst just an overnight stay passing through Melb, the Park Hyatt met and exceeded the high Hyatt levels of comfort and excellence in accommodations. Small beef is the location, sort of a little out of the way and no bar facilities open on the Sunday evening, which meant a walk some ways. Breakfast was excellent, although a little on the upside of dollars. Room and trappings were wonderful
reviews.title: Just a great place to stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2013, traveled on business
reviews.text: All staff members from the bell service, reception, restaurant to housekeeping were very friendly and professional.
reviews.title: One of Australia's best hotels!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We made the mistake of spending our wedding night at the Park Hyatt Melbourne.
reviews.title: Wedding Night Ruined

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My parents had secretly upgraded our original booking and specifically told the staff that this upgrade was to be a surprise for us on the night. Before our stay, I received an email from the Park Hyatt with the details of our upgrade and the extra costs involved! Needless to say my parents and I were not impressed.
reviews.title: Interesting customer service, great location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: When my husband and I tried to check in on our wedding night, we ended up standing at the counter for about 20 minutes while the girl on reception attempted to find the credit card details that my father had provided them earlier.
reviews.title: Great hotel with some flaws

likes.disliked: — Empty promises, problems that shouldn't have occurred, bad swimming pool.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: When we finally got to our room, there was no champagne, strawberries and chocolates (as promised in the Celebration package that has been booked for us). In the end I had to phone reception and specifically request that these things be brought to us.
reviews.title: Another beautiful Park Hyatt hotel!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled on business
reviews.text: Such poor service should not occur in a so-called 5-star hotel at any time, but to have it happen on our wedding night made it even worse. We were bitterly disappointed with our experience at this hotel and will not be recommending it to anyone in the future.
reviews.title: Hyatt didn't meet my expectations...
his hotel should be rated 3 star
reviews.text: The most apalling service levels and staff attitude problems i have ever experienced from a 5 star rated hotel. maybe im not used to Aussie arrogance compared to Asian levels of service but i was desperate to leave after a 6 day stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled with family
reviews.text: whilst the rooms are pleasant enough but you can hear any noise in the hall and some from next door.
reviews.title: One of Melbournes finest

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: stay and regret!
reviews.title: Overall a great experience !

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The park Hyatt must be the best hotel i have ever stayed in by far.
reviews.title: Luxury hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled with family
reviews.text: As soon as you drive up the driveway and walk into the lobby you are overwhelmed by a feeling of being a million miles away from the city.
reviews.title: Assistant manager with an attitude

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I stayed at this Hotel recently with my partner and I must say I really found everything excellent. I wanted to check in earlier then the 2:00PM usual check in time; this wasn’t a problem as my room was ready. The concierge staff were helpful, allowed two keys, honored a late check out of 12.00pm rather then 11.00am which was helpful.
reviews.title: Park Hyatt Luxury, the best hotel in Melbourne !

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled on business
reviews.text: The room was extremely clean, the sheets, couch, chair, bathroom everything was perfect. Our room had extensive views of the city which I requested & again was honored with 3 main windows all having views of the city and beyond ( even the bathroom!)
reviews.title: Needs more for the tech savvy traveller

likes.disliked: — no wireless internet access in room

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The bed was excellent, the extra large pillows were great, felt like my head was in the clouds. Lighting is set onto a dimmer which is also handy. The Central heating / cooling system was a little confusing on how to use, however got the hang of it eventually!
reviews.title: Great Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The spa in the bathroom was lavish, perfect for sipping champagne in. There was even a tv in the bathroom viewable from the spa however was a little fuzzy but not a major problem. The walk in shower was impressive, it could practically fit 5 people in or more, not that you’d want too.
reviews.title: A Restful Stay

likes.liked: — spa bath and walk in robe

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The main tv has all the normal channels along with a large selection of foxtell channels which is useful. The minbar is full stocked, however a little pricey as you’d expect from such a hotel. Room service menu was quite large, however didn’t opt to use it, same goes with the hotels restaurants as there are a wide selection of eateries a tram ride away from the hotel.
reviews.title: Perfect!

likes.liked: — Beautiful large rooms in the suite and excellent service.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled on business
reviews.text: I'm a public speaker and my tours can be really grueling. Between my business needs and need for good food, good service, good bed when I'm tired and trying to keep going, I'm really picky.
reviews.title: My favourite hotel in Melbourne

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled on business
reviews.text: I stay at the Park Hyatt on all of my trips to Melbourne and have never been disappointed. The rooms are great. The bathrooms are a major treat - I love soaking my weary bones in the giant bathtubs while watching mind numbing television at the end of a hard day.
reviews.title: Very Luxurious, overpriced

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled with family
reviews.text: I have never experienced anything but the best service from the Park Hyatt Melbourne. The food is excellent and the room service timely and lots of selection. It feels like a home away from home.
reviews.title: A 3 star hotel with 5 star prices

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I mostly stay for business, but have stayed with my family - including pre-school daughter - and had a great time. There is heaps of room for a rollaway bed in the rooms and it is close to lots of parks, museums, restaurants, and the Aquarium. They have a great kids menu and are very helpful with local, kid-friendly advice. Disneyland it's not, but we certainly felt welcome and had plenty to do.
reviews.title: Good but couple of issues

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled solo
reviews.text: Highly recommended.
reviews.title: More like a Hyatt Regency than a Park Hyatt
Private, pleasant and fantastic overall!
reviews.text: - VERY comfortable.

likes.disliked: — That it was non-smoking. We smoked on the balcony, but felt guilty. :P

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008
reviews.text: - Fantastic view.
reviews.title: Best hotel in Melbourne

description: Overlooking St. Patrick’s Cathedral, Fitzroy Gardens and the cosmopolitan mix of Victorian and modern architecture of the central business district, Park Hyatt Melbourne offers an exclusive sanctuary in the heart of the city. Our hotel in Melbourne CBD provides a warm ambience and exceptional levels of personalised service and luxury amenities. Renowned for having the largest 240 luxury rooms & suites in Melbourne with walk in robes, Italian marble ensuites and open windows, our luxury hotel in Melbourne provides an unparalleled experience of elegant, contemporary luxury. Guests are invited to enjoy the award-winning ‘radii’ restaurant & bar, a decadent Tea Lounge and Park Club Health & Day Spa featuring an indoor aquamarine pool, spa, sauna, gym and private sun deck. Our Melbourne hotel is only 25 km from Melbourne Airport, and is convenient to most city attractions around the city centre. It is within walking distance to the Melbourne Cricket Ground (MCG), home of the Australian Football League (AFL) and test cricket, The Melbourne Museum and the best boutique shopping, cafes, restaurants and theatre districts.
